page.title: 05Risby Poor's Heath 4
page.content: Local Resident: "I remember during the war when they ploughed up the Heath.We used to go over to Icklingham to dances-there were lots of R.A.F. boys there and a gang of us girls used to go.I used to tell my mum that so-and-so was going so she wasn't worried then and we had to cycle there and back.We'd go up Lackford Lane to Lackford and sometimes we'd hear the German bombers coming over.And we'd put our lights out in case they could see them and then we couldn't see-and we forgot all about the furrows and we bumped along.Mostly we pushed our bikes.
